channel.title: How to fix your compiler.. + the error its giving
channel.description: edit fixed it myself, thanks all who tryed to help.

item.title: How to fix your compiler.. + the error its giving
item.dc:creator: @Blast0Scape Blast0Scape
item.description:
@Blast0Scape wrote:

ohh i see, yeah iv had this problem before and i couldnt figure out the answer, its not the compiler, u have to have a lower version of java is waht i figured out

[quote=“terry baby, post:19, topic:432040”][quote author=Blast0Scape link=topic=534747.msg3911240#msg3911240 date=1328752741]
DID you try my code i posted?

@echo off
:menu
title Death-Scape’s compiler
@echo Compiling…
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
pause
[/quote]
yeah, it stated to me in the compiler that its recommended that it should be updated then it closes its self… look below

105v9sl.jpg609×639
[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: How to fix your compiler.. + the error its giving

item.title: How to fix your compiler.. + the error its giving
item.dc:creator: @terry_baby terry baby
item.description:
@terry_baby wrote:

[quote=“voetbal645, post:16, topic:432040”]I’m not stupid i know it’s client sided.
Well look, i helped a friend to help hem making a webclient.
The.class .java files and sign folder are just in 1 map with the compiler and the run.bats.
I try to compile and it works fine.
But when i made 2 folders 1 src and 1 bin and place the .class files in the bin folder and the .java files in the src folder and i want to compile i had just the same error that you have.[/quote]no everything is by its self like you said, i don’t have 2 folders i just have everything in the same thing.

Read full topic
item.source: How to fix your compiler.. + the error its giving

item.title: How to fix your compiler.. + the error its giving
item.dc:creator: @voetbal645 voetbal645
item.description:
@voetbal645 wrote:

I’m not stupid i know it’s client sided.
Well look, i helped a friend to help hem making a webclient.
The.class .java files and sign folder are just in 1 map with the compiler and the run.bats.
I try to compile and it works fine.
But when i made 2 folders 1 src and 1 bin and place the .class files in the bin folder and the .java files in the src folder and i want to compile i had just the same error that you have.

Read full topic

it’s a warning, it compiled, don’t worry your little brains.

That’s what I’m saying.
[/quote]

When did you say that? All I saw was,

[quote author=heatrn11 link=topic=534747.msg3909377#msg3909377 date=1328562164]

You don’t update a compilar… LMAO, it’s just a cmd that uses the classpaths…[/quote]
In my head WINK[/quote]
